text:
This is a 54 year old woman with PMH including COPD on 2L home O2,
   diastolic CHF with dilated RA/LA, recent PNA with PO abx regimen,
   multiple past admissions for hypercarbic respiratory failure, also
   morbidly obese, on home BiPAP while sleeping. Presents to ED after
   family noticed mental status changes. Patient was found to be
   rhoncorous bilaterally with O2 sats in 70's. Hypotensive to 80
   systolic, 102.6 PO, c/o HA, placed on NRB and subsequently intubated,
   with difficulty. 5L fluid given, arterial line and presep catheter
   placed. Placed on scant amount of Levophed with SBP responding into
   120's. ABG signficant for respiratory acidosis with signficant
   hypercarbia, PCO2 initially 105. CXR showed RLL and LLL consolidation.
   While in ED, received 1 gm Vancomycin, 1 gm Ceftriaxone, and 750mg
   Levaquin. Transferred to [**Hospital Ward Name 51**] MICU for further management of PNA and
   hypercarbia.
   Sepsis without organ dysfunction
   Assessment:
   Febrile in ED, 100.4 PO upon admission to [**Hospital Ward Name 51**]. CXR showing possible
   infiltrates. Patient with multiple hospitalizations, most recently d/c
   from [**Hospital1 54**] on [**10-16**] after hospitalization for hypercarbic respiratory
   failure that required MICU admission. Positive UA with >50 WBC so
   urosepsis is a possibility. Vanc/Ceftriax/Levaquin given in ED. Was
   initially on 0.09/mcg/kg/min Levophed however was d/c
d almost
   immediately after being admitted as BP was found 150
s systolic.
   Action:
   UC, BC, UA, CDiff sample sent. Levofloxacin given. Standing Vanco and
   Zosyn for broad coverage. Lactate normal.
   Response:
   Temp down to 98.4 PO. Remains normotensive.
   Plan:
   Follow lactate, CBC, f/u on culture data, re-culture prn. Levo if
   needed for MAP > 65. Abx coverage.
   Respiratory failure, acute (not ARDS/[**Doctor Last Name **])
   Assessment:
   Multiple hospitalizations r/t hypercarbic respiratory failure thought
   to be due to obesity hypoventilation syndrome. Baseline PCO2 is in
   60
s. PCO2 in ED initially 105, pH 7.27. Per ED, she unable to respond
   to questions but was arousable. Subsequently intubated. Upon arrival to
   MICU, vent settings 400/24/100%/8.
   Action:
   Dropped FiO2 to 50%. ABG 7.48/50/70/38.
   Response:
   Dropped rate to 22. Follow-up ABG:
   Plan:
   Serial ABG
s, evaluate mental status for extubation, goal of baseline
   PCO2 in 60
s. Goal of PO2 >70.

info.concept: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease of horses
